content: top just like the part of the body that was worked flat every row begins and ends with a garter edge however to slant the hood away from the face the first three right side row have decreases along the edges row 1 right side ssk k 1 k 20 24 m1 pm on made stitch will be used as center line mcs k to last 2 stitches k2tog 43 51 stitches row 2 and all even row k3 p until last 3 stitches k3 row 3 & 5 ssk k to mcs m1 k the mcs m1 k to last 2 stitches and k2tog row 7 k row 9 k to 1 before mcs m1 k the mcs m1 k to end repeat row 6­9 4 5 times then continue in stockinet with garter edge row 6 & 7 until the hood measures 14 15 cm ending with an even row begin decrease row as follows row 1 k to two before mcs ssk k the mcs k2tog k to end row 3 k repeat row 1 4 once row 9 k to 1 before mcs sl k2tog includes mcs psso row 11 knit for smaller size repeat row 9 for larger size row 13 seam hood shut with kitchener stitch the yarn will be on the front of the hood so it will need to be first pulled through the back stitch as well so that kitchener can be properly set up there will also be one extra stitch witch can easily be worked into the last kitchener stitch by threading the yarn through the loop of the extra stitch and pulling the stitch through to the inside of the hood to tie off finishing the only finishing required is weaving in ends sewing the gaps under the arms shut and sewing on buttons
